newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Portuguese shares end off lows, eyes on Wall St.
newsitem.headline: Portuguese shares end off lows, eyes on Wall St.

text.p: Portuguese shares ended off the lows in light trade with the market's attention focused firmly on Wall Street, which reacted positively to National Association of Purchasing Management index data after tumbling in recent sessions. Fears of another U.S. rate hike and a weakening dollar weighed on market sentiment, dealers said.

Turnover in the cash market was just 5.8 billion escudos, below the recent daily average. The rise of shares in Portuguese insurer Imperio, bucking the overall trend of the market, was due to a buy recommendation from UBS, dealers said. Dealers said the trend on Lisbon bourse tomorrow would depend on the close of Wall Street today.
